body_html:
It could definitely be. At least this is a strong indicator of the problem.

Check python packages to see if you have a folder called external, and if inside of it there is another folder called weblas_weblas_js:
~/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/external/

If you don't, that's a problem with TF's installation. This folder (external) is inside the python wheel package for tensorflow, and is copied to that location. If you want a quick/easy solution, reinstall tensorflow using the pip command, and everything should work fine:
pip3 install tensorflow-gpu

pip3 install tensorflow-gpu
body:
It could definitely be. At least this is a strong indicator of the problem.

Check python packages to see if you have a folder called `external`, and if inside of it there is another folder called `weblas_weblas_js`:
`~/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/external/`

If you don't, that's a problem with TF's installation. This folder (external) is inside the python wheel package for tensorflow, and is copied to that location. If you want a quick/easy solution, reinstall tensorflow using the pip command, and everything should work fine:
`pip3 install tensorflow-gpu`
